intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. petiolaris, commonly known as the petioled sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with long petioles, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
